name: 余盛延
objective: 本課程引導學生熟悉變遷中之英美文學作品典律，並探討其形成之歷史文化背景及隨變遷所產生之時代意義。課程中將討論與作品相關之社會、政治、文化、心理、哲學、理論等議題，使學生能瞭解欣賞選讀作品，並銳化其思辯能力及分析技巧。學生須於課前詳讀作品，並於課堂上參與討論。
schedule:
09/19  Introduction

09/26  General comments on Christopher Marlowe’s Doctor Faustus (1604; 1616); Doctor Faustus [Prologue, 1.1-1.4]

10/03  Doctor Faustus [2.1-2.3]

10/10  Holiday

10/07  Doctor Faustus [3 Chorus; 3.1; 3.2]

10/24  Doctor Faustus [4 Chorus; 4.2]

10/31  Doctor Faustus [5.1-Epilogue] 

11/07  General Comments on Nathaniel Hawthorne’s The Scarlet Letter; The Scarlet Letter [The Custom-House]

11/14  The Scarlet Letter [I. The Prison-Door; II. The Market-Place; III. The Recognition]

11/21  The Scarlet Letter [IV. The Interview; V. Hester at Her Needle; VI. Pearl; VII. The Governor’s Hall]

11/28  The Scarlet Letter [VIII. The Elf-Child and the Minister; IX. The Leech; X. The Leech and His Patient]

12/05  The Scarlet Letter [XI. The Interior of a Heart; XII. The Minister’s Vigil; XIII. Another view of Hester; XIV. Hester and the Physician]

12/12  The Scarlet Letter [XV. Hester and Pearl; XVI. A Forest Walk; XVII. The Pastor and His Parishioner]

12/19  The Scarlet Letter [XVIII. A Flood of Sunshine; XIX. The Child at the Brook-side; XX. The Minister in a Maze]

12/26  The Scarlet Letter [XXI. The New England Holiday; XXII. The Procession; XXIII. The Revelation of the Scarlet Letter; XXIV. Conclusion]

01/02  Final Exam

01/09  Review and Discussion
materials:
Marlowe, Christopher. The Tragical History of Doctor Faustus. (A 1604 Version) Ed. David Bevington and Eric Rasmussen. English Renaissance Drama: A Norton Anthology. Ed. David Bevington, et al. New York: Norton, 2002. 250-284.

Hawthorne, Nathaniel. The Scarlet Letter. Oxford UP.
